posts.cooked:
hi yall, some or the pinions that we were sent with our swerve X kits don’t fit our NEO motors. Has anyone else had this problem and how has your team fixed it?

EDIT: pinions are too small, not too big

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
As in the pinions are a slip fit on the motors rather than a press fit?

If the former use a retaining compound (green loctite, 638)

There have been plenty of threads this week on this and similar issues.
oop forgot to mention that they’re actually too small instead of too big, let me update my original post.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
Assuming it is the correct part and they seem close you could try putting the motor in the freezer and heating the pinions up to boiling water temperatures (be very careful if using a torch, you don’t want to wreck any heat treatment) and try a press fit. Hopefully the differences from thermal expansion should make the fit better.

Knowing how you press them on would also be helpful (i.e. do you have access to an arbor press? )

Measuring the difference between the bore of the pinion and OD of shaft to the nearest thousandth of an inch may be helpful for troubleshooting

we have an arbor press, so far we’ve tried sanding down our neo shafts the tiniest bit and then heating up the pinions with our heat gun and trying to press them on, but that didn’t work. We’re nervous about trying to sand the shafts down more bc we don’t want other things to be loose on the shaft.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
That is totally fair.

Accurate measurements of the pinion bores and shafts of the physical hardware you have would be the biggest single trouble shooting step at this point.

Part numbers of what you ordered may also help.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
